content:
• Tuesday, April 24, 2012
  • IGT

    More on International Game Technology (NYSE:IGT): FQ2 beat both EPS and revenue estimates on a...

    More on International Game Technology (NYSE:IGT): FQ2 beat both EPS and revenue estimates on a 13.5% jump in revenue. Net earnings declined 11% Y/Y however, as higher expenses offset top line sales growth. The company ups its FY12 EPS forecast to a range of $0.98 - $1.04, up from earlier estimates of $0.93 - $1.03. Shares +2.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:02 PM
  • IDCC

    InterDigital (IDCC +3.8%), which soared last summer after putting itself on sale, and crashed...

    InterDigital (IDCC +3.8%), which soared last summer after putting itself on sale, and crashed after finding no buyers, rallied today on a dealReporter column claiming the company is again exploring a sale of its 3G/4G patents, according to sources. This time around, InterDigital is said to have split its portfolio into bundles to draw more buyers, and is "less ambitious on valuation." The company is reportedly "late into the first round of bidding."
     
     
     
     
    | 6:59 PM | 3 Comments
  • QRVO

    More on RF Micro Devices' FQ4: Revenue drop has much to do with the company's Nokia exposure....

    More on RF Micro Devices' FQ4: Revenue drop has much to do with the company's Nokia exposure. Gross margin of 30.1% up 190 bps Q/Q, but down 530 bps Y/Y. RF Micro is guiding for FQ1 revenue of $202M and EPS of $0.00-$0.02 vs. a consensus of $201.9M and $0.03. RFMD +3% AH, possibly getting a lift from Apple's FQ2 report along with other power amplifier vendors, though the company isn't an Apple supplier.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:24 PM
  • UIS

    Unisys (NYSE:UIS): Q1 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $928.4M (+1.9% Y/Y) beats by $42M....

    Unisys (NYSE:UIS): Q1 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $928.4M (+1.9% Y/Y) beats by $42M. Shares +15.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • FTNT

    Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT) guides on its Q1 earnings call for Q2 revenue of $123M-$127M and EPS of...

    Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT) guides on its Q1 earnings call for Q2 revenue of $123M-$127M and EPS of $0.12 (consensus of $123.9M and $0.12), and 2012 revenue of $515M-$530M and EPS of $0.49-$0.53 (consensus of $516.9M and $0.52). Shares +5.9% AH, validating Nomura's upgrade earlier today. Q1 product revenue growth (+32% Y/Y) and billings growth (+28%) both exceeded total revenue growth (+26%). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:12 PM
  • SMCI

    Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ:SMCI): FQ3 EPS of $0.19 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $240M (+2.5%...

    Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ:SMCI): FQ3 EPS of $0.19 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $240M (+2.5% Y/Y) misses by $11M. Shares -1.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM
  • IRBT

    iRobot (NASDAQ:IRBT): Q1 EPS of $0.02 in-line. Revenue of $97.8M (-8% Y/Y) beats by $1.5M....

    iRobot (NASDAQ:IRBT): Q1 EPS of $0.02 in-line. Revenue of $97.8M (-8% Y/Y) beats by $1.5M. Shares -2.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM
  • IGT

    International Game Technology (NYSE:IGT): FQ2 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $541M...

    International Game Technology (NYSE:IGT): FQ2 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $541M (+13.5% Y/Y) beats by $21M. Shares +2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM
  • AWAY

    HomeAway (NASDAQ:AWAY): Q1 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $64.1M (+23.3% Y/Y) in-line....

    HomeAway (NASDAQ:AWAY): Q1 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $64.1M (+23.3% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • ENTR

    Entropic Communications (NYSEARCA:ENTR): Q1 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $59.1M...

    Entropic Communications (NYSEARCA:ENTR): Q1 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $59.1M (-17.3% Y/Y) beats by $1.6M. Shares -12.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • INTC

    Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) has acquired assets related to Cray's (NASDAQ:CRAY) high-performance...

    Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) has acquired assets related to Cray's (NASDAQ:CRAY) high-performance computer (HPC) interconnect program, including IP and personnel. Intel will integrate the technology with its Xeon server CPU platforms, such as Romley. The move comes 3 months after Intel bought QLogic's InfiniBand hardware business - those products are often used in HPC applications. CRAY +23.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM | 2 Comments
  • NBR

    More on Nabors (NYSE:NBR): Stronger-than-expected Q1 results continue NBR's streak of improved...

    More on Nabors (NYSE:NBR): Stronger-than-expected Q1 results continue NBR's streak of improved core earnings, as U.S. oil-and-gas producers adopt more complex drilling techniques to access harder-to-reach reserves, boosting the top line. NBR also is working to improve operational efficiency after acknowledging in the past it strayed off target in its E&P forays. NBR +1.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM
  • DDIC

    DDi New (NASDAQ:DDIC): Q1 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $68.9M (+3.8% Y/Y) beats by...

    DDi New (NASDAQ:DDIC): Q1 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $68.9M (+3.8% Y/Y) beats by $2.9M. Shares +0.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM
  • CYMI

    Cymer (NASDAQ:CYMI): Q1 EPS of $0.68 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.24. Revenue of...

    Cymer (NASDAQ:CYMI): Q1 EPS of $0.68 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.24. Revenue of $152M (-2.5% Y/Y) beats by $12M. Shares -7.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM
  • CTS

    CTS (NYSE:CTS): Q1 EPS of $0.07 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.17. Revenue of $147M...

    CTS (NYSE:CTS): Q1 EPS of $0.07 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.17. Revenue of $147M (-3% Y/Y) misses by $12M. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM
  • CENX

    Century Aluminum (NASDAQ:CENX): Q1 EPS of -$0.04 beats by $0.18. Revenue of $326M (flat Y/Y)...

    Century Aluminum (NASDAQ:CENX): Q1 EPS of -$0.04 beats by $0.18. Revenue of $326M (flat Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares +2.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM
  • EW

    Edwards Lifesciences (NYSE:EW): Q1 EPS of $0.53 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $459M (+13.56% Y/Y)...

    Edwards Lifesciences (NYSE:EW): Q1 EPS of $0.53 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $459M (+13.56% Y/Y) beats by $10M. Shares +3.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM
  • FTNT

    Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT): Q1 EPS of $0.11 in-line. Revenue of $117M (+25.6% Y/Y) beats by $3M....

    Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT): Q1 EPS of $0.11 in-line. Revenue of $117M (+25.6% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares +5.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • AAPL

    Unsurprisingly, many Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) chip suppliers are rising following the company's...

    Unsurprisingly, many Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) chip suppliers are rising following the company's strong FQ2, even more than the tech sector at large. OVTI +6.7%. QCOM +2.3%. BRCM +4.6%. SWKS +5.6%. TQNT +7.6%. CRUS +8.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM | 2 Comments
  • CB

    Ace (ACE): Q1 EPS of $2.05 beats by $0.18. Shares +1.1% AH. (PR)

    Ace (ACE): Q1 EPS of $2.05 beats by $0.18. Shares +1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • AAPL

    More on Apple: Gross margin was 47.4%, up 270 bps Q/Q and 610 bps Y/Y. Cash/investment balance...

    More on Apple: Gross margin was 47.4%, up 270 bps Q/Q and 610 bps Y/Y. Cash/investment balance rose to $110B. Asia-Pac, likely driven by China, played a big role in the earnings beat: sales rose 32% Q/Q and 114% Y/Y, compared with 20%+ Q/Q seasonal drops for the Americas and Europe. iPhone revenue +85% Y/Y with implied ASP of $646, iPad revenue +132%. Mac desktops +8%, Mac notebooks -1%. Retail revenue +38% Y/Y. AAPL +7.4% AH. (PR) (CC webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM | 18 Comments
  • NFX

    More on Newfield Exploration (NYSE:NFX): Q1 EPS beats Street estimates on solid gains in oil...

    More on Newfield Exploration (NYSE:NFX): Q1 EPS beats Street estimates on solid gains in oil production and aggressive hedging tactics. Oil and liquids liftings were up 35% over the comparable period in 2011. The company raises FY12 expectations for total production to 292 – 302 Bcfe, versys previous guidance of 290 – 300 Bcfe, and reiterates its capital budget of $1.5B – $1.7B. Shares +1.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • AAPL

    More on Apple's FQ2: The company is guiding for FQ3 revenue of $34B and EPS of $8.68, below a...

    More on Apple's FQ2: The company is guiding for FQ3 revenue of $34B and EPS of $8.68, below a consensus of $37.4B and $9.93, though guidance is typically conservative. 35.1M iPhone sales beat whisper number of 32M, though 11.8M iPad sales fall short of a whisper of 13M. 4M Macs sold, in-line with lowered expectations. 7.7M iPods sold, down 15% Y/Y. AAPL +6.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 6 Comments
  • AAPL

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL): FQ2 EPS of $12.30 beats by $2.24. Revenue of $39.2B (+59% Y/Y) beats by...

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL): FQ2 EPS of $12.30 beats by $2.24. Revenue of $39.2B (+59% Y/Y) beats by $2.4B. 35.1M iPhones sold, 11.8M iPads. Shares +4.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 57 Comments
  • AFL

    More on Aflac (NYSE:AFL): Q1 easily tops estimates on a 21% jump in revenue. Net earnings nearly...

    More on Aflac (NYSE:AFL): Q1 easily tops estimates on a 21% jump in revenue. Net earnings nearly doubled Y/Y, due primarily derivatives gains stemming from a stronger yen/dollar exchange rate. The company also raises FY12 guidance, now expecting an EPS of around $6.46 - $6.65. The Street is at $6.47 per share. Shares +4.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • BIDU

    More on Baidu's Q1: Q2 guidance implies only 56%-60% Y/Y revenue growth, down from Q1's 75%...

    More on Baidu's Q1: Q2 guidance implies only 56%-60% Y/Y revenue growth, down from Q1's 75% and Q4's 82.5% Traffic acquisition costs fell 10 bps Q/Q to 7.8%. Active ad customers rose 3.2% Q/Q and 17.2% Y/Y to 321K. Revenue per customer, while up 49.4% Y/Y, fell 7.6% Q/Q to $2,112. Though seasonality had an impact, this is a troubling stat given Q/Q growth was flat in Q1 '11. R&D expenses rose 85.2% Y/Y, SG&A expenses 43.9%. BIDU -7.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 8 Comments
  • AFL

    Aflac (NYSE:AFL): Q1 EPS of $1.74 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $6.2B (+21.9% Y/Y) inline. Shares...

    Aflac (NYSE:AFL): Q1 EPS of $1.74 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $6.2B (+21.9% Y/Y) inline. Shares +4.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 4 Comments
  • BIDU

    Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU): Q1 EPS of $0.87 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $677.1M (+75% Y/Y) misses by...

    Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU): Q1 EPS of $0.87 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $677.1M (+75% Y/Y) misses by $0.3M. Company expects Q2 revenue of $847.2M-$867M vs. consensus of $860.2M. Shares -9.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 2 Comments
  • REGN

    Regeneron (REGN -3%) slips after the IG's office of the Department of Health and Human Services...

    Regeneron (REGN -3%) slips after the IG's office of the Department of Health and Human Services recommends that the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid establish a national payment code for Roche's (ROG +0.2%) Avastin. The IG also recommended that doctors be educated about clinical and payment issues related to the drug.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • JNPR

    More on Juniper's (JNPR +8%) Q1 report: The company is guiding for Q2 revenue of $1.03B-$1.06B...

    More on Juniper's (JNPR +8%) Q1 report: The company is guiding for Q2 revenue of $1.03B-$1.06B and EPS of $0.15-$0.17 vs. a consensus of $1.05B and $0.20. Q1 product sales fell 9% Y/Y to $772M, while service revenue rose 16% to $261M. Router sales (62% of product revenue) fell 21% Y/Y (likely share losses to Cisco), offsetting a 23% increase in switch sales (boosted by QFabric) and slightly higher security/other revenue. Enterprise and service provider sales both fell. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • KWK

    Howard Weil downgrades Quicksilver Resources (KWK -1.5%) to Market Perform from Market...

    Howard Weil downgrades Quicksilver Resources (KWK -1.5%) to Market Perform from Market Outperform as a result of commodity price changes. The firm lowers its 2012 gas price deck from $3.38/Mcf to $2.43/Mcf, its 2013 gas price estimate from $4.50/Mcf to $3.50/Mcf and 2014 price assumption from $5.00/Mcf to $4.50/Mcf.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • ANGO

    Shares of AngioDynamics (ANGO +1%) adds to yesterday's gains on the company's announcement that...

    Shares of AngioDynamics (ANGO +1%) adds to yesterday's gains on the company's announcement that it had resumed shipments of its NanoKnife System in the U.S. market following a voluntary software modification.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • OTEL

    Shares of Otelco (OTT -17.4%) have been cut in half since news late Friday that major client...

    Shares of Otelco (OTT -17.4%) have been cut in half since news late Friday that major client Time Warner Cable (TWC) indicated it would not renew its contract to acquire wholesale network connections from the company. The contract represented 11.7% of OTT's 2011 revenue. OTT suspends dividends on the common stock portion of its income deposit securities.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • JNPR

    Juniper Networks (JNPR +8.2%) soars after posting its Q1 results ahead of schedule. Juniper...

    Juniper Networks (JNPR +8.2%) soars after posting its Q1 results ahead of schedule. Juniper reports Q1 revenue of $1.03B (-6% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.16, soundly above a consensus of $976.8M and $0.13. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • CE

    Celanese (CE -1.4%) missed Q1 EPS estimates, as higher costs and weaker demand in Europe trimmed...

    Celanese (CE -1.4%) missed Q1 EPS estimates, as higher costs and weaker demand in Europe trimmed operating profits. The specialty materials company says challenging market conditions in Europe and Asia will last longer than expected, so it will operate plants at "appropriate levels" to maximize profits while keeping a lid on discretionary spending.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • HXL

    Hexcel (HXL +1.3%) trades up after beating Q1 estimates late yesterday. Revenue jumped 21% on...

    Hexcel (HXL +1.3%) trades up after beating Q1 estimates late yesterday. Revenue jumped 21% on higher sales better execution. The company also raises its FY12 EPS forcast to $1.45 - $1.55 from its previous guidance of $1.33-$1.45. Separately, Wedbush ups the shares to Outperform, citing the company's margin improvement and higher FY12 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • CNC

    Medicaid insurer Centene's (CNC -5.7%) Q1 EPS edged lower Y/Y on higher medical costs from...

    Medicaid insurer Centene's (CNC -5.7%) Q1 EPS edged lower Y/Y on higher medical costs from adding new business, but it raised its 2012 profit target amid a $500M increase in expected revenue. CEO Michael Neidorff calls the quarter "mixed," noting the period tends to be volatile and that high medical costs in new markets can take three to four months to normalize.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • BWLD

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD) jumps the gun to releases its earnings before market close, although...

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD) jumps the gun to releases its earnings before market close, although investors aren't caught napping by the light comparable-store sales for Q1. Shares are off 5.5%, after spiking down a rapid-fire 7% after the premature news. (Official PR not yet available)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • BIG

    Analysts start to rain down on Big Lots (BIG -23.1%) after its FQ1 sales warning crushed the...

    Analysts start to rain down on Big Lots (BIG -23.1%) after its FQ1 sales warning crushed the spirit of investors. The common theme from analysts downgrading at MKM Partners (to Neutal) and Raymond James (to Market Perform) the retailer is that the company failed to capitalize on the weakness of its rivals - primarily the big void left by the downsizing at Sears.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 2 Comments
  • OCZ

    Piper defends solid-state drive (SSD) vendor OCZ Technology (OCZ -4.9%), which has...

    Piper defends solid-state drive (SSD) vendor OCZ Technology (OCZ -4.9%), which has fallen sharply since early February. The firm sees worries about falling NAND flash prices and OCZ's use of an inferior SSD controller chip in its new Vertex 4 drives as overblown. As a buyer of NAND flash, OCZ benefits from lower prices, and the controller used by OCZ is less important than its use of good firmware. (previous)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • FRO

    Shipping stocks perk up as rates and bookings show some weekly improvement off of increased...

    Shipping stocks perk up as rates and bookings show some weekly improvement off of increased demand from China as it continues to import more oil from Africa as an alternative to Iran. The Baltic Dry Index +2.2% to $1,090, as the sector falls stocks back in favor for the day. Advancers: FRO +5.1%, OSG +5.1%, EXM +3.6%, GNK +1.5%, NM +1.6%, PRGN +1.8%, EGLE +8.1%, SBLK +2.2%, SB +2.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • CR

    Crane (CR -6.8%) dips on a mixed Q1 report, beating slightly on revenue but coming up short on a...

    Crane (CR -6.8%) dips on a mixed Q1 report, beating slightly on revenue but coming up short on a per share basis. Net earnings actually rose 6.6%, driven by sales gains in its aerospace and electronics and fluid handling segments.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • KSU

    Shares of Kansas Southern (KSU +4.4%) ride a Q1 earnings beat higher, as the company reports...

    Shares of Kansas Southern (KSU +4.4%) ride a Q1 earnings beat higher, as the company reports carload volume improved 7% Y/Y. The company plans to start paying quarterly dividends in Q2, while also paring down debt in an effort to achieve investment-grade status to match rivals.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • WTS

    Brean Murray removes Watts Water (WTS -3.1%) from its Near-Term Focus List on the back of its...

    Brean Murray removes Watts Water (WTS -3.1%) from its Near-Term Focus List on the back of its disappointing Q1 forecast, saying the limited information provided raises some concerns. Shares remain Buy rated however, with a reduced price target of $45 from $48.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • DWRE

    Demandware (DWRE -2.9%), which went public in March, is selling off on underwriter coverage day....

    Demandware (DWRE -2.9%), which went public in March, is selling off on underwriter coverage day. Goldman (Neutral) praises the developer of e-commerce site-building tools for having a differentiated offering and low churn, but is worried about its high valuation. Oppenheimer (Buy) likes Demandware's barriers to entry and strong revenue visibility, while Canaccord (Buy) sees "several rapid growth years ahead."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • AAL

    UBS sees a merger between US Airways (LCC +4.8%) and American Airlines (AAMRQ.PK) closer to...

    UBS sees a merger between US Airways (LCC +4.8%) and American Airlines (AAMRQ.PK) closer to taking off after union support was nailed down. Analyst Kevin Crissey maintains a Buy rating on LCC, taking the position that if the deal clears the final few hurdles - shares could double in price.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM | 2 Comments
  • WAT

    Waters Corp (WAT -7%) takes a hit after its Q1 misses across the board. Net earnings fell 6.2%...

    Waters Corp (WAT -7%) takes a hit after its Q1 misses across the board. Net earnings fell 6.2% as a slower release of capital spending plans by pharmaceutical companies and weaker sales in certain developing markets weighed on top line results.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS -5.6%) pares back a bit of yesterday's double-digit gain inspired by an...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS -5.6%) pares back a bit of yesterday's double-digit gain inspired by an investment from Jana Partners into the embattled book seller. After the smoke cleared from the announcement of the big position from the activist investment group, Maxim Group's John Tinker points out that it adds to the firm's challenges and makes the future for BKS even more unclear.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • OFIX

    Orthofix International (OFIX +4%) agrees to sell its sports medicine business to private-equity...

    Orthofix International (OFIX +4%) agrees to sell its sports medicine business to private-equity firm Water Street Healthcare Partners for $157M in cash, as the company refocuses its strategy on its spine and orthopedic units.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • MM

    Shares of Millenial Media (NYSE:MM) fall off 6.6% as the mobile advertising concern continues...

    Shares of Millenial Media (NYSE:MM) fall off 6.6% as the mobile advertising concern continues its four-week slide from an IPO opening price of $25. The company boasts an impressive 16% mobile ad market share, but valuation remains a concern.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • GE

    Argus says General Electric's (GE +1.4%) valuation looks attractive at current levels, coming...

    Argus says General Electric's (GE +1.4%) valuation looks attractive at current levels, coming off its stronger than expected Q1 results earlier this morning. Argus thinks the company's industrial businesses should benefit from increasing demand for healthcare imaging products and rising commercial air traffic, and its record order backlog means it's spring-loaded for growth in FY12.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • GOOG

    Today's drop in Motorola Mobility (MMI -2.5%) shares to $37.46, a day after the company scored a...

    Today's drop in Motorola Mobility (MMI -2.5%) shares to $37.46, a day after the company scored a favorable ITC ruling, makes clear the Street is worried the Google acquisition won't go through, or perhaps just not at $40/share. Google's announcement it's selling Samsung's Galaxy Nexus for $399 unlocked via the Play Store could have some investors spooked. Arb traders stand to pocket a 6.8% gain if the deal goes as planned. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • WFT

    Weatherford (WFT +3.9%) missed on its Q1 earnings and revenues, and lowered Q2 estimates, but...

    Weatherford (WFT +3.9%) missed on its Q1 earnings and revenues, and lowered Q2 estimates, but shares surge after CEO Bernard Duroc-Danner says he expects growth across the board for 2012. WFT "remain(s) constructive on North America, both top line and margin," and expects international revenue to rise 20% and operating income to double in H2.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • PSS

    Collective Brands (PSS +3.9%) is weighing final offers to sell itself to South Korea's E-Land or...

    Collective Brands (PSS +3.9%) is weighing final offers to sell itself to South Korea's E-Land or Wolverine World Wide (WWW -0.4%), Bloomberg reports. The Payless Shoe parent has attracted at least one bid valued at ~$2B; PSS is said to plan to make a decision on the bids in the coming days.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • ULTA

    Analysts at Raymond James size up the weakness today in Ultra Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA) as a buying...

    Analysts at Raymond James size up the weakness today in Ultra Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA) as a buying opportunity. While shares have shed 4.9% on heavy volume, it's a pullback off of a 36.9% YTD run that Raymond James sees as a work in progress.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM | 1 Comment
  • WTS

    Watts Water Technologies (WTS -2.1%) shares slip after the company lowers its Q1 forecast,...

    Watts Water Technologies (WTS -2.1%) shares slip after the company lowers its Q1 forecast, citing lower gross margins caused by higher material costs and manufacturing inefficiencies. WTS, which makes valves that control water flow, filtration systems and drainage devices, says it expects EPS of $0.40-$0.43 on sales of $364M, below previous estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • DGIT

    Shares of Digital Generation (DGIT +7.8%) shoot higher after the company snaps up privately-held...

    Shares of Digital Generation (DGIT +7.8%) shoot higher after the company snaps up privately-held Peer39. The company says it will integrate its new buy into one of its other acquisitions - Israeli-based MediaMind.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA -6.7%) falls again (previous) thanks to a cautious Baird note; shares are now down...

    Zynga (ZNGA -6.7%) falls again (previous) thanks to a cautious Baird note; shares are now down 39% since March 26. Baird thinks the Q1 payments data found in Facebook's latest S-1 suggests Zynga had Q1 net bookings of $230M from Facebook transactions, which translates into total bookings of just ~$300M, below the firm's estimate of $320M. Nonetheless, Baird is positive on Zynga's long-term positioning in social and mobile gaming.

    The U.S. commercial truck market should generate solid growth this year after truck makers align...

    The U.S. commercial truck market should generate solid growth this year after truck makers align their production with moderating demand, says Eaton (ETN +3.4%) CEO Alexander Cutler. Rising fuel costs, order cancellations and factory production cuts have fueled a bearish outlook for the truck industry, but "we're not panicked," Cutler says. Truck production ramped up late last year, and appears to be continuing into this year as well.

    More on ARM's (ARMH -5.4%) Q1: Shipments of ARM-based chips for mobile devices were flat Y/Y (+10% in Q4), while shipments for other products rose only 15% (+40% in Q4). This is probably leading to fears Q2 royalty revenue (based on Q1 shipments) will be light, and could be mildly troubling for the chip industry.
